intro: Argythamnia tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny stems. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture and have three distinct lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Argythamnia tricuspidata is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
